title: NBN/Telstra help me please
body: hi guys. ive been having this problem for many many months now, but now its gotten a lot worse. i got nbn a few months ago, and now my internet is absolute garbage, everytime i played league, i would occasionally disconnect and i cant move or use any abilites, but everybody else could move just fine. now its gotten way worse, and im getting leavebusters for 'AFK/leaving', when its my lag and i cant even control it. i just got 5 leave busters a couple days ago when my internet just compltely disconnected and i couldnt even log back on, and when i got back on i got 5 leavebusters. now just today, i was playing to get rid of the timers, and i just got another 5 leavebusters and idek what the hell happened. as soon as champ select ended, i couldnt load, and i had to restart league again and then it worked. then, i went to my lane and disconnected 3 times before dying in a fight cuz i couldnt move. i probably disconnected like 20 times at least throughout the whole game and i felt absolutely useless, but the worst part was at the end of the game, i disconnedcted before their nexus was destroyed. my score was like 0/11/30 i played soraka and my game was 'attempting to reconnect', and i left for like 5 minutes and come back and it still disconnected. i just closed the game and when i got back onto the client it says i have another 5 leavebusters. this is so freaking annoying and i want ot know if anybody else has this problem and can help me.

replies.body: thanks guys i fixed it, idk why but it just suddenly started working again. thanks

Hey

Internet problems can really suck, and if you aren't used to dealing with them it can feel like you're powerless to do anything.  The most important thing you can do is arm yourself with information, learn as you go, and be proactive about solving it.

My advice here would be to start working through with some testing and see how far you get.  It might be your ISP, but there might be things you can do to learn about where the source of the problem is, and ultimately tip the internet-stability gods in your favour!

* Check what type of NBN you have (FTTP / FTTN / HFC etc).  They can suffer all from different issues.
 * If you're on Fibre to the Node (FTTN) - Check for sync speed in your router and make sure it matches the speed you've signed up for in your NBN plan.  If not, call Telstra and let them know (they are [refunding customers](http://www.smh.com.au/business/comment-and-analysis/42000-telstra-nbn-customers-to-get-compensation-rather-than-speed-20171108-gzh6di.html) who don't get what they are paying for)
* Check if you've reached a data limit and have had your connection shaped/restricted

For testing, there are a few things to try:

* First up - identify an easy way to replicate the problem.  It could be via a speedtest, by loading into a LoL custom game, using [pingplotter](https://www.pingplotter.com/fix-your-network/getting-started?page=2) - there are many ways.
* Switch from WiFi to using an Ethernet cable (even just as a test)
* Remove other network devices so only your PC/Test device is on your internet connection
* Log in to your router and check if anything looks off - also check and see if you can update its firmware to the latest version

There are some other tips and tricks on what you can do over at our [Lag Report](https://lagreport.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/steps) site, which would definitely be worth a look in your case.

Cheers
